description: The Kindred Spirits Orchestra (KSO) has been performing to a great acclaim, sold-out audiences, and standing ovations at the Flato Markham Theatre and at the Richmond Hill Centre for the Performing Arts, as well as at the CBC Glenn Gould Studio in Toronto. Led by the charismatic Maestro Kristian Alexander, the KSO is enjoying growing popularity among York Region's residents and continues to attract avid audiences across the Greater Toronto Area. In 2013, 2015 and 2019, the KSO was presented Awards from the Government of Canada for the "extraordinary work of the Kindred Spirits Orchestra promoting Canadian music and Canadian composers in the community as well as for the orchestra’s community outreach and educational programs”. Between 2016 and 2019, the Government of Ontario awarded 21 members of the KSO for their contribution to the development of arts and culture in the community.

reviews.title: KSO is great!
text: KSO is great! I was impressed much by KSO conductor Kristian Alexander performed in opening night gala last year October. He is an excellent conductor to lead his professional KSO musical group, I’m looking forward to see the concert on Oct 17 2020 by KSO : Beethoven Fifth Symphony, Erik Kreem’s Waltz and a world première of a Violin concerto by Werner Chan.   It would be spirit inspiration during the pandemic this year.

reviews.title: Kristian Alexander is so talented and his music school is wonderful!
text: Wonderful concert...just as good as the TO symphony and so close to home and reasonably psriced for the whole family...Kristian Alexander is a very talented man and his music school was 'intrumental' in piquing my childern's musical interests...it has been ten years since they attended his school and still enjoy playing guitar and piano today!

reviews.title: July 1, 2016
text: Fabulous music, very talented musicians, really enjoyed their concert at
The bandstand in Unionville.

reviews.title: Unforgettable!
text: I had a chance to be there with my friends this spring. It was unforgettable! The sound was so deep and reach! I would advise everybody to come there for a concert regardless of the age.

reviews.title: March 25, 2016 Concert
text: 'From Darkness to Light' a wonderful concert. Great full sound and sight line, too.
The Host, Alexa Petrenko did a good introduction to the pieces. Also, Alastari Thorburn-Vitols sang like an angel. Very talented artists! Easy drive from Toronto with lots of free parking.

reviews.title: Wonderful performance
text: I went with some friends and the performance was outstanding, we greatly enjoyed it. I'd certainly go see them again!

reviews.title: I had a great time
text: Really great time, the orchestra and soloist were amazing. Excellent atmosphere, I will definitely be going back!

reviews.title: We were entertained by the concert when we watch at Markham. It's very entertaining.
text: We had a nice experience watching the Kindred Spirit Orchestra. What a wonderful concert. The conductor is lively and entertaining. I am impressed with orchestra soloist.   All of them have a very memorable performance, They are talented performers especially the conductor, he is excellent & very entertaining. He is professional. The musicians were talented and enjoyable in their performance.

reviews.title: Mind blowing
text: Me and my wife were blown away by their performance at Unionville. I am really out of words. I would recommend for anyone who is interested to make sure they dont miss this amazing performance.

reviews.title: A great place for parents and kids to love music together
text: I took my family and they loved it! The conductor is world class but also takes time to make sure guests feel welcome. He even let my little boy hold the baton.

reviews.title: Impressive!
text: I admit that I am a music snob, but I was actually quite impressed with this orchestra. A friend invited me to Handel's Messiah, and I was a bit surprised by the size of the orchestra, and how tight the performance was. The 4 soloists were just as good as anything else I've heard in the genre, as was the choir. The woman who introduced the orchestra and the conductor also had a little preamble with facts and trivia about the work, which was interesting, and lasted just long enough. The venue was also comfortable. I highly recommend KSO to local Marhkamites looking to add some culture to their entertainment roster, Torontonians willing to brave the trip, tourists, everyone!

reviews.title: Long Time Listener
text: KSO offers is a high quality orchestra that offers a diverse schedule throughout the year. Markham is fortunate to have this level of entertainment.

reviews.title: So much talent
text: This orchestra is amazing. It is a not for profit orchestra that has give so much joy to the York Region community in Ontario. I couldn't believe how talented the musicians were. Can't wait for the next show. Well done. Maestro Kristian Alexander is awesome!!!

reviews.title: Great Experience overall!!!
text: I have been to Kindred Spirits Orchestra concerts and I can say that I have always enjoyed them. The musicians are all professionals and well trained in what
they do. The sound is great and they also have many concert enhancements that we rarely see elsewhere like pre-concert chats, intermission discussions, post-concert mingle with the musicians.

reviews.title: Amazing experience!
text: We've been to several KSO shows over the years and immensely enjoy ourselves each time. Their program is quite varied and their orchestra is professional and great sounding. The venue is also nice and intimate and the auditorium has great acoustics. The conductor is very lively and entertaining and I believe he and his orchestra received standing ovation in each performance we have seen.

reviews.title: Very nice experiace
text: It was a very nice experience for me to be at the Flato Markham Theater to enjoy the concert of Kindred Spirits Orchestra.

reviews.title: Flato Markham Theatre - KSO Spring Concert
text: What a wonderful concert!!  The Kindred Spirits Orchestra of Markham and Piano soloist William Bellehumeur were absolutely spectacular at the KSO’s April 3, 2015 spring concert at Flato Markham Theatre.   The KSO, under the expert guidance of Conductor Kristian Alexander, gave us Weber, Liszt and Schumann and showcased another talented Canadian musician.  The audience loved it!!

reviews.title: Good for community orchestra
text: Although there are some professional lead players in the orchestra, the bulk of the orchestra are students of the conductor's music school or university music students. Kristian the conductor is a fine musician but arrogant to the tee. Performances are pleasant but it is a community orchestra and not a professional orchestra. So musicians and music teachers beware. For the general public who like the classics and can't tell the difference between community, student and professional performances, this is the right orchestra for you.
Soloists are generally very good but you know they are paying a high price for them to perform.
A group can only be as good as it's weakest performer.

reviews.title: Not worth the $$$
text: I felt as if I were at my kid's school concert.  I realize this is an organization focused on children and talent, but our experience was so poor it was almost laughable.  Microphones weren't operating for part of the concert, lines were forgotten - it was Tiny Talent Time meets the Gong Show.  I don't have kids in KSO, so unless you do, don't bother.  It is like attending other children's recitals.

reviews.title: Excellent Orchestra with expansive repertoire
text: The orchestra is excellent lead by a highly talented Conductor. Maestro Alexander has showcased a wide variety of repertoire this past year including contemporary music and chamber concerts. The orchestra has a high standard for a community orchestra and showcases talent in all of the sections.

reviews.title: Outstanding orchestral performance!
text: What a wonderful evening my husband and I had when we attended a fine performance in Markham by The Kindred Spirits Orchestra. It was our first time attending one of their concerts, and we were very pleased with the expertise and tremendous talent displayed by the musicians. They were capably led by their master conductor Kristian Alexander, who knew exactly how to showcase the hidden gems of his orchestra to enhance the stellar sound of each soloist. I was also very impressed by the high calibre of the performers, and would highly recommend to anyone who has an appreciation of classical music to experience the wondrous music of the KSO. It'll be a pleasurable night out for one and all.

reviews.title: A Musical Experience
text: I have attended three concerts, and have enjoyed each immensely! The orchestra and guest musicians were wonderful and exceeded my expectations.  The only thing I would change is with regards to the start time.  An earlier start to the program would be greatly appreciated.

reviews.title: Kindred Spirits Concerts at Flatco Theatre Markham
text: My wife and I have attended several Kindred Spirits Concerts and have always enjoyed the selection of music offered  and the guest artists.
The  hall offers great seats anywhere you sit with fine acoustics.
Kindred Spirits Concerts are one of our favorite outings.
And parking is conveniently at the front door and  free - what a bonus!

reviews.title: A little known cultural gem in Markham
text: I discovered the KSO at the Canada Day Concert in Unionville's Mainstreet bandshell in 2014 and have attended several concerts during the current season. This Orchestra is a delightful addition to the Markham music scene and I'd recommend the KSO to anyone who has even a passing interest in classical music.The ticket prices are modest for the level of performance and the atmosphere inviting for all.

I noticed that the KSO plays a variety of composers during the year and within concerts. For the more discerning attendees, this should allow one to choose what they enjoy the most. For the less discerning, variety is the spice of life!  Some compositions I'll admit I enjoyed more than others (I loved the Ravel left hand piano concerto but can't say I'm as much of a Prokofiev fan), but each was performed extremely well by the soloists and orchestra. All very worthy performances.
I'd recommend giving the KSO a try.

reviews.title: Top musicians
text: The Kindred Spirits Orchestra is a five star orchestra with top musicians.I would recommended to all art and music lovers.

reviews.title: They were great
text: The kindred spirit orchestra was great. Would definitely recommend for everyone to go to their concerts!

reviews.title: High quality!
text: Had a great time with the family at the KSO concerts. We are regular patrons of their concert series and have never once been disappointed. The orchestra consists of high calibre performers and students and this orchestra brings out the best in each of its performers. The concerts are well-organized and brings lots of little things in such as silent auctions, Classical 96.3 hosts, etc. that makes the concert experience so much better. Definitely recommend!

reviews.title: A gem in the desert
text: Unique experience at an excellent price. A great opportunity for kids to play in a real orchestra. A good chance for Marhkamites to come out of their shelters.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience !!
text: A truly memorable performance, you have such talented performers.
I enjoyed the pre-chat, the interaction with members of the orchestra over break.
Congratulation on another successful showing and thank you for the wonderful experience.
Elizabeth

reviews.title: Amazing Performances!
text: I would take my whole family to listen to The Kindred Spirits Orchestra when they are performing at Unionville Main Street and they never disappoint us!
Captivating, thrilling, Passionate are just a few words that come to mind when I am listening to them perform.

reviews.title: A must see!
text: A must see!

The venue is warm and welcoming with great acoustics.  They have an amazingly talented orchestra that provides only the highest calibre in performances. Their programs are well organized and provide a wide varierty in classical music.

reviews.title: One of A Kind
text: The KSO is by far one of the most unique and diverse orchestras I have ever witnessed. Listening to them live placed me in a musical trance that made my jaw drop every single time. They are all wonderful people and their talents are most definitely noticed. I strongly recommend anyone who has not seen them play yet to go right away!!!

reviews.title: Great performances!
text: Talented musicians at work here. I went for an orhcestral performance, with an amazing soloist (Antonia DeWolfe). Fantastic, all around experience.
A solid 5/7.

reviews.title: Cheers !!!
text: Excellent performance, amazing interpretation of the musicians.  Congratulations to the conductor.  Cheers !!!  I am glad I had the chance to see it.

reviews.title: Growing up with KSO
text: I moved to Markham when my son was 2 years old and now he is 11. He has been going to KSO for the last 9 years.  He has grown up with this community in Markham and KSO has become part of his life.  Now he plays piano, violin and clarinet.  I am very grateful to be part of this wonderful community and truly cherish that my son is growing up with music in his life.

reviews.title: Amazing Orchestra
text: I had a great experience. Markham is so fortunate to have this orchestra. Incomparable
to other orchestra's I have attended in other cities, especially in GTA .

reviews.title: bad music
text: not a good group. 90% musicians are not professional, 40% of violinist are kids. even those principal are not good enough. conductor's conducting technique is bad , plus he doesn't know music that much. so I don't know why this orchestra become the orchestra for markham ? there are more better group in markham which are much much better than, why , a lousy orchestra can survive ? really?  nobody in markham know what is good music anymore ?

reviews.title: Not to be missed
text: Kindred Spirits Orchestra is a great orchestra with outstanding musicians and a large repertoire. I definitely advise all music lovers to attend their concerts. The soloists that perform with the orchestra are also outstanding. Lead by Maestro Kristian Alexander in Markham theatre with great acoustics  and lovely atmosphere.

reviews.title: Canada day concert
text: The canada day performance at Unionville was so excellent that Kindred Spirit got a standing ovation after 1812 Overture! Really heart warming to see. They also performed works by Beethoven Mendelssohn Brahms and Copland. All that with a single rehearsal! Truly wonderful!
